intro: Hemionitis leachii, commonly known as the New Zealand spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiky inflorescence and slender, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Hemionitis leachii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
